news.news: NASA’s Webb Reaches Alignment Milestone, Optics Working Successfully
news.descripcion: Following the completion of critical mirror alignment steps, NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope

news.news: El Telescopio Webb De La NASA Alcanza Un Hito En Su Alineación
news.descripcion: El telescopio Webb de la NASA alcanza un hito en su alineación

news.news: NASA To Discuss Progress As Webb Telescope’s Mirrors Align
news.descripcion: NASA will hold a virtual media briefing at noon EDT Wednesday, March 16, to provide an update on the James Webb Space Telescope’s mirror alignment.

news.news: Studying The Next Interstellar Interloper With Webb
news.descripcion: One of the most exciting findings in planetary science in recent years is the discovery of interstellar objects passing through our solar system. So far, astronomers have confirmed only two of these interlopers from other star systems — 1I/'Oumuamua in 2017 and 2I/Borisov in 2018 — but many, many more are thought to exist.

news.news: NASA To Discuss Webb Telescope Progress, Mirror Alignment
news.descripcion: NASA will hold a media teleconference at 11 a.m. EST on Friday, Feb. 11, to share progress made in the early stages of aligning the James Webb Space Telescope’s mirrors.

news.news: NASA Engineer Receives Ralph Coats Roe Medal For Education, Mentorship
news.descripcion: NASA’s Dr. Aprille Ericsson has received the Ralph Coats Roe medal from the American Society for Mechanical Engineers (ASME), honoring her international work encouraging young people, women, and people from other underrepresented groups to pursue STEM careers.

news.news: NASA Looks Ahead In 2022: Artemis, X-59, Lunar Exploration, And More
news.descripcion: After a 2021 filled with complex challenges and extraordinary successes, 2022 is shaping up to be another busy year for NASA.

news.news: NASA Leaders Lauded At Innovation Event In California
news.descripcion: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope Program Director Gregory L. Robinson, along with other agency leaders, will be honored at the “Innovation&Equity 21: 50 Most Important African Americans in Technology” event in San Francisco on March 5.

news.news: How NASA In Silicon Valley Will Use Webb To Study Distant Worlds
news.descripcion: Scientists at NASA’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley will be among the first to observe the cosmos with Webb, and they’re looking for clues about how exoplanets form, what they’re made of, and whether any could be potentially habitable.

news.news: Ames Contributions To NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope
news.descripcion: NASA’s Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley made significant contributions to early mission concepts, technology development, and modeling. Ames researchers also will lead and contribute to the mission's science investigations.

news.news: Capturing All That Glitters In Galaxies With NASA’s Webb
news.descripcion: Within the first year of operations, NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope will help researchers complete a more detailed sketch of the stellar life cycle with high-resolution infrared-light images of 19 galaxies.

news.news: NASA To Discuss Webb’s Arrival At Final Destination, Next Steps
news.descripcion: Scientists and engineers operating NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope will answer questions about the mission’s latest milestones in a NASA Science Live broadcast at 3 p.m. EST Monday, Jan. 24, followed by a media teleconference at 4 p.m.

news.news: Sunshield Successfully Deploys On NASA’s Next Flagship Telescope
news.descripcion: The James Webb Space Telescope team has fully deployed the spacecraft’s 70-foot sunshield, a key milestone in preparing it for science operations.

Discover how Webb partners with the astronomy community.
